intro: Eriogonum microtheca var. idahoense, commonly known as Idaho jointweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the buckwheat family (Polygonaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. This variety is distinguished by its smaller leaves and more compact inflorescences compared to the typical form of Eriogonum microtheca.
